channel.title: Special attack
channel.description: Hey people, how can I change the max hit of a special attack?

item.title: Special attack
item.dc:creator: @wanbliscape wanbliscape
item.description:
@wanbliscape wrote:

I hate when people know the answer and look at your question and say stupid things or don’t reply. Here is how you change the max hit of a special, all of it revolves around percentages. First go in your source, go to src, then keep going until you see model. Open it then go to combat. Open PlayerCombat. Then search 11694 or Armadyl Godsword. There is alot of them so keep searching until you see something similar to this

}
if (p.weapon == 11694) { //Armadyl godsword
playerHitDamageMelee *= 1.25;

Change the .25 to something more like 30 or 40. This means when you use your special you will hit 25 percent more. By change the .25 to like 40, you will hit 40 percent more. If you want you can add this

	}
	if (p.weapon == 11694) { //Armadyl Godsword
		p.accuracy += 0.95;

That means when you hit you hit 95 percent accuracy. you can change it to like 1.00 or 99.99 or something. So you hit always when you spec and not 0’s. If you want you can also change the + sign to -, meaning it lowers your accuracy when you spec. You can do it for all your weapons aswell. Like dmace or magic shortbow lowers your accuracy when you spec, but I like changing it to 1.0, always hiting =). I hope this helps!

Read full topic

only way to make special attack hit higher is to make the weapon being used for it stronger
